intro: Inga nubium, commonly known as the cloud forest inga, is a deciduous tree native to the humid, high-altitude regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with elongated leaflets and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a pod containing several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Inga nubium plays an important ecological role in cloud forests, providing habitat and contributing to soil fertility.
